category.name: Design
category.description: Master design principles, user experience, and visual communication techniques.

sub_categories.name: UI/UX Design
sub_categories.description: Learn user interface and user experience design principles and best practices.

exercises.title: Advanced UI Components
exercises.description: Master advanced UI component design and implementation.

tasks.title: Component Design Systems
tasks.question:
What is a design system?

Consider: Consistent design language and reusable components
tasks.hint: Think about creating a unified design language
options: A collection of reusable components and design guidelines

tasks.title: Responsive Design
tasks.question:
What is the mobile-first approach in responsive design?

Consider: Starting with mobile and scaling up
tasks.hint: Think about designing for the smallest screen first
options: Starting with mobile design and scaling up to larger screens

tasks.title: Accessibility Standards
tasks.question:
What does WCAG stand for in accessibility?

Consider: Web accessibility guidelines

exercises.title: User Research & Testing
exercises.description: Master user research methods and usability testing techniques.

tasks.title: User Research Methods
tasks.question:
What is the difference between qualitative and quantitative research?

Consider: Types of data collected
tasks.hint: Think about numbers vs. descriptive data
options: Qualitative uses numbers, quantitative uses descriptions
Qualitative uses descriptions, quantitative uses numbers

tasks.title: Usability Testing
tasks.question:
What is the main purpose of usability testing?

Consider: Identifying user problems
tasks.hint: Think about finding issues with the user experience
options: To identify usability problems and improve user experience

tasks.title: A/B Testing
tasks.question:
What is A/B testing used for?

Consider: Comparing two versions
tasks.hint: Think about testing different versions to see which performs better
options: Comparing two versions to see which performs better
